active_learning.discussion_prompt: In an era of increasing privacy concerns, debate the optimal frequency and scope of periodic rescreening for cybersecurity roles. Should it be annual for all employees, or risk-based? Consider costs, ethics, NIST CSF guidelines, and real-world trade-offs like negligent retention lawsuits.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Personnel Security under NIST-aligned frameworks. Topic: 'Periodic Rescreening Requirements' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > During Employment Security > Continuous Monitoring and Compliance). Voter consensus: 82.9% approval on pedagogy/completeness. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards optimized for spaced repetition and Bloom's Taxonomy. Cover all learning objectives evenly (4-6 per level: REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, APPLY/ANALYZE, EVALUATE/CREATE). Distribute across 4 scaffolding layers (Layer 1: Foundation, Layer 2: Components, Layer 3: Implementation, Layer 4: Integration). Incorporate active learning hooks (e.g., scenario-based Qs from problem-solving exercise). Use this research context: Periodic rescreening re-evaluates dynamic backgrounds (criminal, driving, licenses) to mitigate negligent retention. Differs from continuous monitoring (real-time). Frameworks: NIST CSF 2.0 (Govern/Identify), NIST 800-53 PS family, CMMC (via 800-171), HITRUST, ISO 27001 A.7. Prioritize risk-based frequency, automation. Flashcard Format (JSON array): [ { "front": "Question text (MCQ: A) Opt1 B) Opt2 etc.)", "back": "**Correct: A**\nExplanation: [Justify with def/evidence]. Distractors wrong: [Why each]. Example: [Real-world]. Objective: [e.g., APPLY #3]. Layer: [1-4]. Ref: [NIST CSF]", "type": "MCQ|Q&A|Cloze", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER|UNDERSTAND|etc.", "scaffolding_layer": 1 } ] Ensure: 60% MCQs with distractor protocol (plausible errors: confuse terms/frameworks, ignore triggers). Varied difficulty. Measurable verbs. No spoilers on front. Promote active recall.
